text:
Hello everyone,

Is there a route to save this type of event? I need it to make an export.

Thank you very much,
( inside a contact or a company... )

hello everyone, a short question. Provides the api the possibility to convert a fieldtype into another without losing the values. I want to somehow convert a textfield into a numberfield and all the values are numbers.. thx for your help
Well it's the timeline object probably :slightly_smiling_face:

If you scroll up or search another user had a similar Batch API question earlier in the last week or two. They were getting some similar odd results where the batch API bulldozed over some error conditions and did not flag them, when the non-batch API did flag them.

It would be possible, but could not happen automatically, you would have to use API to store down the values, fix the field, then put the values back, with your own scripts on the first and second half, and the UI in between.

The other option would be trying to export in the UI, fix the field, and reimport to it again.
Fun times... glad you got a solution...

Hi we are trying to figure out how to get the contact object to post over when we receive a workflow extension request from HubSpot. This comment by <@UQ922BSPP> gave me hope that we could, but so far no luck in determining how to tell HubSpot to post the entire contact object. Right now we just get `objectType` AND `objectId` .

Does anyone know how to tell HubSpot to include the contact object in the HTTP post to our server?

> Currently, while using the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/webhook_information|Workflow Webhook action>, it is not possible to configure the POST body being sent. If you'd like to have full control over the payload of the request, I'd recommend for your team to explore the <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflow-extensions/workflow-extensions-overview|Workflow extensions overview>.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Limiting-Webhook-Post-Data/td-p/354659>
You can't. They are a real minimal payload for performance reasons. You are supposed to call back for the data you need after that.
Will have a look, thank you.

Found this on the forms for any one else who runs into this issue.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Issue-with-batch-contact-creation-API-v3/m-p/351560>
